DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : The Charleston Heart Study Evans County Study begin 1960 prospective cohort study design study risk factor cardiovascular disease biracial community . The Charleston Heart Study cohort comprise random sample Black white men woman resident Charleston County South Carolina 35 year age old 1960 ( n=2281 ) . For Evans County Study ( n=3102 ) , 100 percent population Evans County , Georgia 40 year old 50 percent resident 15-39 year age recruit ( 92 percent response rate ) . Because paucity data Blacks woman , data combine Charleston Evans County study provide important information existence low cholesterol/mortality association potential effect modifier understudy populations.. DESIGN NARRATIVE : Using datasets , study : ( 1 ) determine J-shaped U-shaped relationship cholesterol all-cause non-CVD mortality observe Charleston Evans County Georgia cohort Blacks white ; ( 2 ) investigate existence racial , gender , place residence ( urban versus rural ) differences relationship cholesterol mortality particular emphasis identification racial gender difference low cholesterol/mortality association ; ( 3 ) determine socioeconomic status ( SES ) modify effect cholesterol mortality Black white woman Black white men determine effect modification SES , find exist , different urban rural setting . Data analyze separately cohort comparison across cohort pool combined analysis . Cox proportional hazard regression analysis use model relationship total cholesterol follow mortality endpoint : cause , cardiovascular disease , coronary heart disease , stroke , cancer , non-cardiovascular disease/noncancer . Racial gender difference relationship cholesterol mortality investigate race-sex stratified analyse inclusion interaction term variable regression model . Urban/rural difference cholesterol/mortality association evaluate test significance difference regression coefficient cholesterol term regression model run separately study cohort . The effect modification cholesterol/ mortality association SES investigate comparison regression coefficient cholesterol model analyze separately high low SES stratum model contain SES cholesterol interaction term .
